question: Who wrote the book "Navasaha Sankacharitam"?
explanation:
The Sanskrit poet Padmagupta Parimala composed \"Navasaha Sankacharitam\" , in which he described the exploits of Paramara
King Sindhuraja (995-1010 AD) of Dhara, who possessed the title \"Nava Sahasanka\". It deals with the marriage of SindhurajaÂ  (the father of King Bhoja of Dhara) with the Shashi Prabha (daughter of Nagaraja Shankhapara) and the personal aspects of his life.
